meanings.definition: To calculate the total of a subset of numbers.
meanings.sent1: I subtotaled the cost of my groceries before heading to the checkout.
meanings.sent2: She subtotaled the expenses for the month to keep track of her budget.
meanings.sent3: The math wizard subtotaled the numbers so quickly, it seemed like magic.
meanings.sent4: His attention to detail when subtotaling was like a magnifying glass on a tiny ant.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's explanation of subtotaled made it crystal clear in my mind.

meanings.definition: To determine the subtotal of a group of items.
meanings.sent1: Before making the purchase, I subtotaled the items in my cart.
meanings.sent2: The cashier subtotaled the products to give the customer the final amount.
meanings.sent3: The robot subtotaled the items in a mechanical dance, amusing the onlookers.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to subtotal quickly was like a superpower in the world of shopping.
meanings.sent5: The image of subtotaled items in his mind was as vivid as a colorful painting.
